channel.title: Epeen
channel.description:
Increase it here.
I'll begin.
[code]Class10.actionPerformed(Ljava/awt/event/ActionEvent;)V 0: GETSTATIC Class12.anInt107(I) 25174220[SS]1 15290002[SS]1 19224790[UU]-1 # 1: ISTORE 2 25174220[SS]1 15290002[SS]1 19224790[UU]-1 # 15431769[0]1 2: GETSTATIC Class1.aJCheckBox71(Ljavax/swing/JCheckBox;) 25174220[SS]1 15290002[SS]1 19551481[1]1 # 3: INVOKEVIRTUAL javax/swing/JCheckBox.isSelected()Z 25174220[SS]1 15290002[SS]1 19551481[1]1 # 3203712[2]1 4: ILOAD 2 25174220[SS]1 15290002[SS]1 19551481[1]1 # 23491286[3,12]1 5: IFNE L13 25174220[SS]1 15290002[SS]1 19551481[1]1 # 23491286[3,12]1 16602326[4]1 6: IFEQ L11 25174220[SS]1 15290002[SS]1 19551481[1]1 # 23491286[3,12]1 7: ICONST_1 25174220[SS]1 15290002[SS]1 19551481[1]1 # 8: PUTSTATIC Class1.aBoolean37(Z) 25174220[SS]1 15290002[SS]1 19551481[1]1 # 30191657[7]1 9: ILOAD 2 25174220[SS]1 15290002[SS]1 19551481[1]1 # 10: IFEQ L15 25174220[SS]1 15290002[SS]1 19551481[1]1 # 21061094[9]1 11: L11 25174220[SS]1 8116722[SS]1 18992192[1]1 # 12: ICONST_0 25174220[SS]1 8116722[SS]1 18992192[1]1 # 13: L13 25174220[SS]1 32019423[SS]1 4469286[1]1 # 23491286[3,12]1 14: PUTSTATIC Class1.aBoolean37(Z) 25174220[SS]1 32019423[SS]1 4469286[1]1 # 23491286[3,12]1 15: L15 25174220[SS]1 20471808[SS]1 2544881[1]1 # 16: INVOKESTATIC Class1.method154()V 25174220[SS]1 20471808[SS]1 2544881[1]1 # 17: RETURN 25174220[SS]1 20471808[SS]1 2544881[1]1 # [/code]
Try and do that with BCEL!
Hint: There are 3 local variables and a maximum stack of 2.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: 16 February 2008, 06:38:24 PM[/size][hr]Class10.actionPerformed(Ljava/awt/event/ActionEvent;)V
boolean var = anInt107; boolean stack = aJCheckBox71.isSelected(); if (var) goto L13; if (!stack) goto L11; aBoolean37 = true; if (!var) goto Exit; L11; stack = false; L13: aBoolean37 = stack; Exit: method154(); return;

item.title: Epeen
item.dc:creator: @super_OLDACCOUNT super_OLDACCOUNT
item.description:
@super_OLDACCOUNT wrote:

k00dr:

It’s ok, I was kind of confused for a while too

yeah, i was just thinking of IFNE as ‘if false’, but in reality, it was ‘if true’.

Read full topic

item.title: Epeen
item.dc:creator: @super_OLDACCOUNT super_OLDACCOUNT
item.description:
@super_OLDACCOUNT wrote:

[quote=“k00dr, post:19, topic:181794”][quote author=super_ link=topic=243358.msg2061346#msg2061346 date=1203324091]
k00dr, what i meant is pop a value off the stack, and compare it’s value with 0. which, if it is 0, would signal it’s false. basically if (!var) goto L11;
[/quote]

No, that’s incorrect. If the value equals to 0, then the condition succeeds (is true).

ifne (if not equal to 0) = if value is not zero, then jump, otherwise fall through

ifne = if(var) = if(var != 0)[/quote]
ah, please excuse my ignorance, i failed to see how much of an idiot i was being.

Read full topic

item.title: Epeen
item.dc:creator: @k00dr k00dr
item.description:
@k00dr wrote:

super_:

k00dr, what i meant is pop a value off the stack, and compare it’s value with 0. which, if it is 0, would signal it’s false. basically if (!var) goto L11;

No, that’s incorrect. If the value equals to 0, then the condition succeeds (is true).

ifne (if not equal to 0) = if value is not zero, then jump, otherwise fall through

ifne = if(var) = if(var != 0)

Read full topic

item.title: Epeen
item.dc:creator: @super_OLDACCOUNT super_OLDACCOUNT
item.description:
@super_OLDACCOUNT wrote:

‘IFNE LABEL’ is supposed to pop the stack and check if it’s 0, if so, branch to LABEL. The problem is that you’re interpreting it wrong; ILOAD 2, IFNE L11 would be like:

if (!var) goto L11; in decompiled-code-speak.
I could be dead wrong, though.

Read full topic

item.title: Epeen
item.dc:creator: @BAsh_CntLgn BAsh(CntLgn)
item.description:
@BAsh_CntLgn wrote:

Here is the the equivalent code to the JSR bullshit:

public static String decodeString(String enc) { char[] array = enc.toCharArray(); if (array.length == 0) { char c = array[0]; } for (int i = 0; i < array.length; i++) { char c = array[i]; int fact = -1; switch(i % 5) { case 0: fact = 52; break; case 1: fact = 73; break; case 2: fact = 76; break; case 3: fact = 84; break; default: fact = 7; break; } array[i] = (char) (c ^ fact); } return new String(array); }
Thats right. Its designed to throw an exception if passed an empty string.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: 17 February 2008, 11:01:19 AM[/size][hr][quote=“super_, post:10, topic:181794”]i know (0 and 1), but if this is a decompiler, it’s pretty dumb.[/quote]
Their loaded from integers but they’re treated as booleans in the code. See ILOAD IFNE/IFEQ.
[br][br][size=1]Posted on: 17 February 2008, 11:09:07 AM[/size][hr]Looks like the xor values change.

[code] switch(i % 5) {
case 0: // ‘\0’
byte0 = 0x4c;
break;

    case 1: // '\001'
        byte0 = 107;
        break;

    case 2: // '\002'
        byte0 = 39;
        break;

    case 3: // '\003'
        byte0 = 125;
        break;

    default:
        byte0 = 59;
        break;
    }[/code]

Read full topic

…stored as bytes when in arrays[/quote]

item.title: Epeen
item.dc:creator: @BAsh_CntLgn BAsh(CntLgn)
item.description:
@BAsh_CntLgn wrote:

Well my decompiler is built for “natural language processing” so it doesn’t conform to strict standards compliance. It looks like somebody built the string obbing by hand as I haven’t seen a compiler EVER do this with JSRs:

Class7.<clinit>()V BIPUSH 6 ANEWARRAY DUP ICONST_0 LDC String:x? t6i5wD!%&b JSR L34 AASTORE DUP ICONST_1 LDC String:x? t1i:~L JSR L34 AASTORE DUP ICONST_2 LDC String:x? t4i!eM JSR L34 AASTORE DUP ICONST_3 LDC String:x? t2i&fS&"'s[') JSR L34 AASTORE DUP ICONST_4 LDC String:x? t5i 9bF( 0 JSR L34 AASTORE DUP ICONST_5 LDC String:x? t3i=fY&"0 JSR L34 AASTORE PUTSTATIC Class7.aStringArray104([Ljava/lang/String;) GOTO L94 L34: ASTORE 0 INVOKEVIRTUAL toCharArray()[C DUP ARRAYLENGTH SWAP ICONST_0 ISTORE 1 SWAP DUP_X1 ICONST_1 IF_ICMPGT L81 L46: DUP ILOAD 1 L49: DUP2 CALOAD ILOAD 1 ICONST_5 IREM TABLESWITCH [0,3] {68} [56,59,62,65] L56: BIPUSH 52 GOTO L70 L59: BIPUSH 73 GOTO L70 L62: BIPUSH 76 GOTO L70 L65: BIPUSH 84 GOTO L70 L68: BIPUSH 7 L70: IXOR I2C CASTORE IINC 1 +1 SWAP DUP_X1 IFNE L81 DUP2 SWAP GOTO L49 L81: SWAP DUP_X1 ILOAD 1 IF_ICMPGT L46 NEW DUP_X1 SWAP INVOKESPECIAL <init>([C)V INVOKEVIRTUAL intern()L SWAP POP RET 0 L94: RETURN

Read full topic

Hint: There are 3 local variables and a maximum stack of 2.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: 16 February 2008, 06:38:24 PM[/size][hr]Class10.actionPerformed(Ljava/awt/event/ActionEvent;)V

boolean var = anInt107;
boolean stack = aJCheckBox71.isSelected();
if (var) goto L13;
if (!stack) goto L11;
aBoolean37 = true;
if (!var) goto Exit;
L11;
stack = false;
L13:
aBoolean37 = stack;
Exit:
method154();
return;
